intro: Ceropegia dicapuae, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and tubular flowers. The plant typically produces small, pale yellow or greenish-white blooms that are often clustered together. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
